Thu, Aug 20, 2015, 15:29 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 1 min Technavio Says the Prevalence of Atrial Fibrillation Will Improve the Ablation Catheters Market in Europe Through 2019 Press Release : Technavio – 24 minutes ago Print 
LONDON--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- 
Technavio has published a new report on the ablation catheters market in Europe ,which is expected to grow at a CAGR of over 10% from 2015-2019. 
About the Report 
According to the latest report by Technavio, atrial fibrillation has become an important public health concern over the last two decades. It is estimated that the number of new cases of AF is expected to rise from 120,000 in 2014 to 215,000 by 2030. 
“With the increasing number of individuals with atrial fibrillation and other cardiac arrhythmias, the adoption of catheter ablation procedures will increase as these procedures reduce surgical time and cost, and improve patient outcomes,” says Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of Technavio. 
The latest report by Technavio also emphasizes the use of robotic-assisted navigation technologies, which have significantly improved the navigation of catheter needles, electrodes, and tips to the target during ablation procedures. 
“The new technology used in cardiac catheters enhance visualization of the catheter's orientation, thereby improving procedural efficiency,” adds Ghaus. 
Market Scope and Calculation of Market Size 
The new Technavio report covers the present scenario and growth prospects of the ablation catheters market in Europe from 2015-2019. To calculate the market size, we consider revenue generated from sales based on different types of catheters, including single-point ablation catheters and multi-electrode ablation catheters, and different procedures, including atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia, and supraventricular tachycardia.
